arm_group.description: 4 mg of Dexamethasone and 4 mL of 0.25% bupivacaine
40 mg of Triamcinolone and 4 mL of 0.25% bupivacaine

brief_summary.textblock:
Trigeminal neuralgia is a craniofacial pain syndrome that is typically characterized by
      unilateral severe, recurrent, electrical pain in one or more distributions of the trigeminal
      nerve. Current treatment strategies include oral medications as first line therapy with
      surgical interventions reserved for those patients who are refractory to medications or
      unable to tolerate medication side effects. Despite these current treatment options, many
      patients continue to have symptoms. Ultrasound-guided trigeminal nerve block allows for fine
      adjustment of the needle tip and direct observation of the medicine.

      Local anesthetic and steroids have been successfully used for diagnostic and or therapeutic
      nerve pain with great success. Steroids can be short or long acting in duration with varying
      side effects. If there exists a difference in duration of action, using the longer acting
      drug will provide a greater period of symptom relief for the patient and may allow the
      patient to undergo fewer interventional procedures.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound Guided Trigeminal Nerve Block for Typical or Atypical Facial Pain

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All patients presenting to the Northwestern Pain Center who are eligible and
             scheduled to receive a ultrasound-guided trigeminal nerve block.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Exclusion is the same for patients who are not eligible for ultrasound guided nerve
             blocks.

clinical_study.official_title: Phase 4 Study Comparing of Dexamethasone to Triamcinolone for Ultrasound-guided Trigeminal Nerve Block: A Randomized Controlled Trial.

overall_official.affiliation: Northwestern University, Feinberg School of Medicine

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects reporting at least 50% overall pain relief

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
